author: pawandhananjay
content:
what would the ssz length limits be for `beacon_blocks_by_range/root` rpc responses?
with https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2686 , the max size of the beacon block could
go much higher than `MAX_RPC_SIZE`, so seems like there's no type specific length upper bound for a post merge `SignedBeaconBlock`.
Should we just consider it a special case and hardcode the `upper_bound = MAX_RPC_SIZE`?

author: djrtwo
content: yes, taht is the intention. It should be the min of either the network or type specific bounds

author: djrtwo
content:
the 10MB is a sanity bound within gas limits (and growth) for a multi-year time horizon and what is in geth today
(max block size is more like 2MB right now)

author: djrtwo
content: most types will have more restrictive bounds than 10MB and those should be respected üëç
